snippet: “Explosive” growth among deeply religious groups has fueled the population rise, a study says, challenging the entrenched image of New York Jews as liberal, affluent and well educated.
abstract: Jewish population of New York City has risen to nearly 1.1 million after decades of decline, fueled by the growth of Hasidic and other Orthodox communities; shift is challenging long-held notions about the group's cultural identity and ideology.
lead_paragraph: “Explosive” growth among deeply religious groups has fueled the population rise, a study says, challenging the entrenched image of New York Jews as liberal, affluent and well educated.

headline.seo: After Declining, New York City’s Jewish Population Grows Again
headline.main: Aided by Orthodox, City’s Jewish Population Is Growing Again
headline.print_headline: With Orthodox Growth, City’s Jewish Population Is Climbing Again
